summary: The Federal Gift Shop Tax Act, introduced in the House of Representatives, allows states to impose sales tax on purchases made at gift shops located on federal property. This includes properties owned or leased by federal agencies, the Smithsonian Institution, the National Gallery of Art, and other specified entities. The bill defines “qualifying purchases” as those made in-person or online through the gift shop and clarifies the definition of “State” to include various U.S. territories and possessions.
